pr_title: Support passing FileOpener for local cache

timeline.message: Support customized way to open InputStream for local cache

timeline.author: calvinjia

timeline.bodyText: Will this cause a performance regression because getStatus will no longer be called lazily?
timeline.author: calvinjia

replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText:
Do we only need 2 of these three methods? ie. the interface open(Path, int) and implementation open(URIStatus, int)? We should always use the hadoop file opener if cache is not enabled?
Also, buffer size is only respected if the cache is not enabled?
timeline.author: calvinjia

replies.bodyText:
Do we only need 2 of these three methods? ie. the interface open(Path, int) and implementation open(URIStatus, int)? We should always use the hadoop file opener if cache is not enabled?

correct, i removed the 3rd open method with FileOpener. originally I thought I needed in Presto land, but it turns out not the case (see draft PR https://github.com/prestodb/presto/pull/15344/files)

Also, buffer size is only respected if the cache is not enabled?

Correct
